lines.content: Add a todo task with just a description.
Schedule events by specifying a start and end time along with a description.
Set deadlines with a specific due date or time and a description.
View a list of all your tasks, including todos, events, and deadlines.
Mark a previously completed task as incomplete.
Remove tasks from the list that are no longer need to be tracked.
Adds a todo task to your list.
A todo task is added to your list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Adds an event with a start and end time.
An event is added to your list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Adds a task with a deadline.
An deadline task is added to your task list
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Displays all tasks in your task list.
A list of all your tasks is displayed.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Marks a specific task as completed
The specific task is marked as done.
OK, I've marked this task as done:
### `unmark` - Mark a task as not done
Marks a previously completed task as not done.
The specific task is marked as not done.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Finds and displays tasks containing the specified keyword.
Tasks containing the keyword are displayed.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Removes a specified task from your list.
The specified task is removed from your list.
* Represents a deadline-type task in the task list.
* A deadline task includes a description and a deadline date or time.
* @param description The text description of the deadline task.
* @param by The deadline date or time for the task.
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task, including its status, description and deadline date or time.
* @return A string representation of the deadline task.
* The {@code Duke} class represents the main entry point for this application.
* The application serves as a task manager that allows users to add, delete and find tasks
* This constructs a new instance of Duke with the specified file path for storage.
* Initialisezes the user interface (Ui) , storage and task list components.
* @param filePath The path to the file used for storage of task data.
tasks = new TaskList(new ArrayList<>()); // initialize with an empty list
Starts the chatbot application. This method shows the welcome message, and then enters
a loop to read and execute commands until the user exits
isExit = Parser.parseAndExecute(userInput, tasks, ui, storage); // Assuming parseAndExecute returns a boolean to indicate exit
ui.closeScanner(); // Close the scanner when the program ends
* The main method serves as the program's entry point.
* It creates a new Duke instance and calls its run method
new Duke("data/tasks.txt").run(); // Assuming the file path to the data file
* Represents exceptions specific to the Duke application.
* This class extended the standard {@code Exception} class and is used for handing custom
* Constructs the new DukeException with the specified details message.
* Represents an event-type task in the task list.
* An event task includes a description, start time and end time.
* Constructs a new Event instance with the specified description, start time and end time.

* @param start The start time of the event.
* @param end The end time of the event.
